result.execSummary:
The defendant William R. Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Comply with sex offender registry.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  Huber privileges are allowed.

As an ATR as a condition of probation as of review hearing on 12/29/15.
Huber allowed, if deft is working.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample(unless previously provided) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: **ANY UNPAID COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE PAID DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 6/15/15 @ 1:30pm
plea hrg set for 5/6/15 @ 2:30pm; email sent to parties
Defense counsel out ill; FPT removed from court's calendar

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Kristyne Watson. Clerk LE.   Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-29-15 @ 9:00am. Jury selection on 5-18-15 @ 9:00am. Atty. Watson also has a trial in Br. 6 previously scheduled on that date. Atty. Watson moves to lower cash bond. State waives notice requirement, but opposes bond modification. Court denies motion to lower bond. Bond continued.
